intro: Rosa spuria var. brachyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dog玫瑰, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, simple leaves with a narrow, lance-shaped form. The plant produces fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its horticultural value lies in its hardiness and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
